item.title: Cindy add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Cindy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description:
"You may not remember the time you let me go first. Or the time you dropped back to tell me it wasn't that far to go. Or the time you waited at the crossroads for me to catch up. You may not remember any of those, but I do and this is what I have to say to you:
Today, no matter what it takes, we ride home together." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "He loved her for almost everything she was & she decided that was enough to let him stay for a very long time." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "I saw them standing there pretending to be just friends, when all the time in the world could not pry them apart. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "We lay there and looked up at the night sky and she told me about stars called blue squares and red swirls and I told her I'd never heard of them. Of course not, she said, the really important stuff they never tell you. You have to imagine it on your own." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "I once had a garden filled with flowers that grew only on dark thoughts but they need constant attention & one day I decided I had better things to do. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Your job is to focus on my personal happiness, she said, & I've got big plans, so break time is over. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "A few said they'd be horses. Most said they'd be some sort of cat. My friend said she'd like to come back as a porcupine. I don't like crowds, she said. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "If you're right & I'm not, I'm going to be hell to live with, she said. So, you better think about that next time you want to be right. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "I used to believe my father about everything but then I had children myself & now I see how much stuff you make up just to keep yourself from going crazy." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "I sometimes wake in the early morning & listen to the soft breathing of my child & I think to myself, this is one thing I will never regret & I carry that quiet with me all day long." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "There are two kinds of teachers: the kind that fill you with so much quail shot that you can't move, and the kind that just gives you a little prod behind and you jump to the skies." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Bill Waterson
item.description: "I'm learning skills I will use for the rest of my life by doing homework...procrastinating and negotiation." -- Bill Waterson

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "If people sat outside and looked at the stars each night, I'll bet they'd live a lot differently. " -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Weekends don't count unless you spend them doing something completely pointless." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "What fun is it being cool if you can't wear a sombrero?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "A little rudeness and disrespect can elevate a meaningless interaction to a battle of wills and add drama to an otherwise dull day." -- Bill Watterson
